title: Vigil planned for Airdrie boy who fell through ice
text:
February 24, 2017 7:17 pm Updated: February 24, 2017 7:26 pm Vigil planned for Airdrie boy who fell through ice By Kim Smith Reporter Global News 
A memorial for the 6-year-old Airdrie boy who fell through the ice on a canal on Feb. 20, 2017. Jill Croteau / Global News What is this?

A candlelight vigil is being held in Airdrie Friday evening for the six-year-old boy who died after falling through the ice in Airdrie Monday afternoon. 
He and his brother were walking on the thin ice in Bayside when they both plunged into the water. 
READ MORE: Memorial grows for Alberta boy who fell through ice in Airdrie 
“As a sign of our love and support, we are asking Airdrie to come out and show this family that their community is here for them to lean on, to give support and love to them now and in the days, weeks and months to follow,” the organizer wrote in a Facebook group . 
WATCH BELOW: A community in Airdrie continues to come to grips with the sudden and tragic loss of a little boy. A 6-year-old plummeted through thin ice on a neighborhood waterway. His 10-year-old brother is still recovering. Jill Croteau has the latest.
